definition / description: description
comments / guidance for external: comments

definition / description: Proposal IDs or names associated with dataset
Type of sample being submitted
comments / guidance for external: This can vary from 'environmental package' if the sample is an extraction.

definition / description: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample sent to EMSL

title / DH column header: EMSL sample storage temperature, deg. C
definition / description: Temperature at which the sample sent to EMSL should be stored
comments / guidance for external: Enter a temperature in celsius. Numeric portion only.

definition / description: If sending multiple technical replicates of the same sample, indicate how many replicates are being sent
If sending biological replicates, indicate the rep number here.
comments / guidance for external: This will guide staff in ensuring your samples are block & randomized correctly
Do not edit these values. A template will be provided by NMDC in which these values have been pre-filled.

todos: Removed identifier = TRUE from dna_samp_ID in JGI_sample_slots, as a class can't have two identifiers. How to force uniqueness? Moot because that column will be prefilled?

definition / description: Give the DNA sample a name that is meaningful to you. Sample names must be unique across all JGI projects and contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, - and _ only.

comments / guidance for external: Units must be in ng/uL. Enter the numerical part only. Must be calculated using a fluorometric method. Acceptable values are 0-2000.
Units must be in uL. Enter the numerical part only. Value must 0-1000. Values <25 by special permission only.

definition / description: 260/280 measurement of DNA sample purity
comments / guidance for external: Recommended value is between 1 and 3.

definition / description: 260/230 measurement of DNA sample purity
comments / guidance for external: Recommended value is between 1 and 3.
Must be unique across all tubes and plates, and <20 characters. All samples in a plate should have the same plate label.

definition / description: Tube or plate (96-well)
Solution in which the DNA sample has been suspended

comments / guidance for external: Note DNAse treatment is required for all RNA samples.

definition / description: List any organisms known or suspected to grow in co-culture, as well as estimated % of the organism in that culture.
examples: expected to contain microbes (59%) fungi (30%), viruses (10%), tadpoles (1%)

definition / description: Provide information on the site your DNA sample was collected from
Describe the method/protocol/kit used to extract DNA/RNA.

definition / description: Give the RNA sample a name that is meaningful to you. Sample names must be unique across all JGI projects and contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, - and _ only.

comments / guidance for external: Units must be in ng/uL. Enter the numerical part only. Must be calculated using a fluorometric method. Acceptable values are 0-2000.
Units must be in uL. Enter the numerical part only. Value must 0-1000. Values <25 by special permission only.

definition / description: 260/280 measurement of RNA sample purity
comments / guidance for external: Recommended value is between 1 and 3.

definition / description: 260/230 measurement of RNA sample purity
comments / guidance for external: Recommended value is between 1 and 3.
Must be unique across all tubes and plates, and <20 characters. All samples in a plate should have the same plate label.

definition / description: Tube or plate (96-well)

comments / guidance for external: Required when 'plate' is selected for container type. Corner wells must be blank. For partial plates, fill by columns. Leave blank if the sample will be shipped in a tube.

definition / description: Solution in which the RNA sample has been suspended

comments / guidance for external: Note DNAse treatment is required for all RNA samples.

examples: expected to contain microbes (59%) fungi (30%), viruses (10%), tadpoles (1%)

definition / description: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point) or interval.
comments / guidance for external: Time should be entered as HH:MM(:SS) in GMT. See here for a converter: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/pst-to-gmt-converter
notes for internal: MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking seconds optional time only

definition / description: Date the incubation was harvested/collected/ended. Only relevant for incubation samples.
comments / guidance for external: Date should be formatted as YYYY(-MM(-DD)). Ie, 2021-04-15, 2021-04 and 2021 are all acceptable.
notes for internal: MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking arb prec date only

definition / description: Time the incubation was harvested/collected/ended. Only relevant for incubation samples.
comments / guidance for external: Time should be entered as HH:MM(:SS) in GMT. See here for a converter: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/pst-to-gmt-converter
notes for internal: MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking seconds optional time only

definition / description: Date the incubation was started. Only relevant for incubation samples.
comments / guidance for external: Date should be formatted as YYYY(-MM(-DD)). Ie, 2021-04-15, 2021-04 and 2021 are all acceptable.
notes for internal: MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking arb prec date only

definition / description: Time the incubation was started. Only relevant for incubation samples.
comments / guidance for external: Time should be entered as HH:MM(:SS) in GMT. See here for a converter: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/pst-to-gmt-converter
notes for internal: MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking seconds optional time only

definition / description: Type of filter used or how the sample was filtered
Other details about your sample that you feel can't be accurately represented in the available columns.
Amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g.insect, plant, total. Can include multiple measurements separated by ;
Reference or method used in determining biomass
comments / guidance for external: required if "non-microbial biomass" is provided

definition / description: The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer. If you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units
Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass
comments / guidance for external: required if "microbial_biomass_C" is provided

definition / description: The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer. If you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units
Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass nitrogen
comments / guidance for external: required if "microbial_biomass_N" is provided

definition / description: Method used for obtaining organic nitrogen
comments / guidance for external: required if "org_nitro" is provided

definition / description: Other treatments applied to your samples that are not applicable to the provided fields
List isotope exposure or addition applied to your sample.
Select all the data types associated or available for this biosample
Select the MIxS enviromental package that best describes the environment from which your sample was collected.
A unique identifier to assign parent-child, subsample, or sibling samples. This is relevant when a sample or other material was used to generate the new sample.
comments / guidance for external: This field allows multiple entries separated by ; (Examples: Soil collected from the field will link with the soil used in an incubation. The soil a plant was grown in links to the plant sample. An original culture sample was transferred to a new vial and generated a new sample)
